extracted-table.table-caption: Causes and manifestations of non-alcoholic Wernicke's encephalopathy in three psychiatric patients with Korsakoff syndrome.
extracted-table.table-wrap-foot: aAge at the time of Wernicke's encephalopathy.bPatient 1 had also muscle weakness.cInformation from hospital records. N/A, Not available.

caption.p: Causes and manifestations of non-alcoholic Wernicke's encephalopathy in three psychiatric patients with Korsakoff syndrome.

th.bold: Symptoms and signs of Wernicke's encephalopathy (Classic triad)
Altered mental state or mild memory impairment

tr.td: Confusion, aberrant behavior, elevated mood, decreased need for sleep

fn.label: a
fn.p: Age at the time of Wernicke's encephalopathy.

fn.label: b
fn.p: Patient 1 had also muscle weakness.

fn.label: c
fn.p: Information from hospital records. N/A, Not available.

extracted-table.table-caption: Results of memory tests for three psychiatric patients with non-alcoholic Korsakoff syndrome.
extracted-table.table-wrap-foot: Values outside brackets are z-scores from the distribution of normative values. Values inside brackets are the difference between the memory test quotient and the general cognitive level quotient. Values of −1.5 or less (z-score), or 15 or more (quotient difference) are in bold.aAge (years) at the neuropsychological examination.bWechsler Adult Intelligence ScaleIII, letter - number span subset.cWechsler Adult Intelligence Scale–III, visual span subset.dHopkins Verbal Learning Test–Revised (HVLT-R), sum of the first three learning trials.eWechsler Memory Scale-III (WMS-III) logical memory I.fBrief Visuospatial Memory Test-Revised (BVMT-R), sum of the first three learning trialsgHVLT-R, delayed free recall trial (trial 4).hWMS-III, logical memory II.iBVMT-R, delayed free recall trial (trial 4).jHVLT-R, recognition trial.kWMS-III, logical memory recognition score + 24 (presumed perfect Verbal Paired Associates recognition). According to Lezak, Howieson, Bigler, and Tranel, Neuropsychological assessment, 5th edition (2012), page 527.

caption.p: Results of memory tests for three psychiatric patients with non-alcoholic Korsakoff syndrome.

table-wrap-foot.p: Values outside brackets are z-scores from the distribution of normative values. Values inside brackets are the difference between the memory test quotient and the general cognitive level quotient. Values of −1.5 or less (z-score), or 15 or more (quotient difference) are in bold.

fn.label: a
fn.p: Age (years) at the neuropsychological examination.

fn.label: b
fn.p: Wechsler Adult Intelligence ScaleIII, letter - number span subset.

fn.label: c
fn.p: Wechsler Adult Intelligence Scale–III, visual span subset.

fn.label: d
fn.p: Hopkins Verbal Learning Test–Revised (HVLT-R), sum of the first three learning trials.

fn.label: e
fn.p: Wechsler Memory Scale-III (WMS-III) logical memory I.

fn.label: f
fn.p: Brief Visuospatial Memory Test-Revised (BVMT-R), sum of the first three learning trials

fn.label: g
fn.p: HVLT-R, delayed free recall trial (trial 4).

fn.label: h
fn.p: WMS-III, logical memory II.

fn.label: i
fn.p: BVMT-R, delayed free recall trial (trial 4).

fn.label: j
fn.p: HVLT-R, recognition trial.

fn.label: k
fn.p: WMS-III, logical memory recognition score + 24 (presumed perfect Verbal Paired Associates recognition). According to Lezak, Howieson, Bigler, and Tranel, Neuropsychological assessment, 5th edition (2012), page 527.

extracted-table.table-caption: Results of non-memory tests for three psychiatric patients with non-alcoholic Korsakoff syndrome.
extracted-table.table-wrap-foot: Values are z-scores from the distribution of normative values. Values ≤ −1.5 are in bold.aAge at the neuropsychological examination.bTrail Making Test.cWechsler Adult Intelligence Scale–III, digit symbol subset.dWechsler Adult Intelligence Scale–III, vocabulary subtest.eWisconsin Card Sorting test.fThe category fluency test (animals) and the word fluency test (words starting with the letter “s”).gAverage of NAB Mazes test, WCST, TMT(A)—TMT(B), and fluency tests.

caption.p: Results of non-memory tests for three psychiatric patients with non-alcoholic Korsakoff syndrome.

table-wrap-foot.p: Values are z-scores from the distribution of normative values. Values ≤ −1.5 are in bold.

fn.label: f

extracted-table.table-caption: Fractional anisotropy (FA) values from diffusion tensor imaging for three psychiatric patients with non-alcoholic Korsakoff syndrome.
extracted-table.table-wrap-foot: Z-scores represent the difference from the mean of controls with one standard deviation as the unit. Values ≤ −2 are in bold.aCorticostriatal projections.

caption.p: Fractional anisotropy (FA) values from diffusion tensor imaging for three psychiatric patients with non-alcoholic Korsakoff syndrome.

table-wrap-foot.p: Z-scores represent the difference from the mean of controls with one standard deviation as the unit. Values ≤ −2 are in bold.

fn.label: a
fn.p: Corticostriatal projections.
